page.title: 16FARMING CHANGES (CONT)
page.content: Hop Growing (continued) The short term outlook looks disastrous unless an immediate solution is found.One answer could be to lower the height of hop plants to allow for easier access,or to make use of a hop picking machine which may create a competitive advantage. Two local advantages are in our favour.1. U.K. farmers are much larger than the European average (200 ha. as compared with 5-50 ha.).2. Most local farmers have a high social standing and a great deal of capital is locked up in the farms. The overall result has been a decrease in acreage by some 27% in the area surveyed since 1970,with a recent acceleration in the trend.Most of the land has been converted to cereals and root crops.
